fundsr 0.1.0

    • fundsr: Rolling differences and Xetra liquidity plots

Save a plot as SVG and queue it for optional PNG export via Inkscape

Source: R/plots.R
ggink.Rd

Saves plot as an SVG file and appends an Inkscape export command to the internal queue (.fundsr$ink_queue) so PNG generation can be performed later in batch (via ggexport()).

ggink(
  file,
  plot,
  px_width = getOption("fundsr.px_width", 1300),
  height = 12,
  width = 12,
  units = "in",
  out_dir = getOption("fundsr.out_dir", "output"),
  save_png = getOption("fundsr.internal_png", FALSE)
)

Arguments

file

Base filename (without extension) used for both the SVG and PNG.

plot

A plot object (typically a ggplot) to be saved.

px_width

Width in pixels for the queued PNG export command, and (if save_png = TRUE) for the PNG saved immediately. Defaults to getOption("fundsr.px_width", 1300).

height

Height of the saved SVG. Defaults to 12.

width

Width of the saved SVG. Defaults to 12.

units

Units for height and width (e.g. "in"). Defaults to "in".

out_dir

Output directory where files are written. Defaults to getOption("fundsr.out_dir", "output").

save_png

Logical scalar; if TRUE, also saves a PNG immediately. Defaults to getOption("fundsr.internal_png", FALSE).

Value

Invisibly returns NULL. Called for side effects.

Details

Optionally, the function can also save a PNG immediately via ggplot2::ggsave() (in addition to queueing the Inkscape command).

The SVG is always written to out_dir as "{file}.svg". An Inkscape export action string is stored in .fundsr$ink_queue[[file]] for later batch PNG export to "{file}.png" at px_width pixels wide.

If save_png = TRUE, a PNG is also written immediately using ggplot2::ggsave() with units = "px". The PNG height is computed as round(px_width * (height / width)) to preserve the aspect ratio implied by the SVG sizing.
